div1.p: Hench offers more suggestions for the Cornwell painting.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George A. Kellogg, March 29, 1941
div1.opener:
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Hotel Nacional
Havana, Cuba
J. H. ANDRUS
805 Cooper St.
Camden, N. J.
March 29, 1941
Dear Mr. Kellogg:
div1.p:
I am grateful to you for sending photographs of the two “ex-
perimental” oil paintings. I understood, from your prev-
ious letter, that you had asked Mr. Willis to leave them for
me. Had I known they would have to be made especially for
me I would not have mentioned it.
Shall be glad to see Mr. Law at any time.

As for Mr. Cornwall and you - I hope you understand that I am
anxious to help in any way that I can.

I note what you say about information from me at this time.
There is one point that will be difficult to correct later,
(after the composition is roughed in), which I feel should be
brought to your attention now.

It is highly improbable that General Wood would have
actually have been present in such a group as shown
in the pencil sketch.

IF he had been in such a group he would not have shared
the background with a bananna plant. He was the
Governor-General - the biggest “big shot” on the Island.

In a group with one major, six or seven contract doc-
tors and three or four privates he would have been the
subject of all the deference Mr. Cornwall can squeeze
out of three tubes.

I like the idea of picturing the privates to represent the
18 volunteers rather than painting portraits of individuals.
I like it so well that I, again, ask you NOT to use my photo.

The privates - if in the group at all - would wear
blouses (like shown in the group photo on hospital
steps); these are of khaki with shoulder straps of
green (about the shade of billiard table cloth.)
They should wear leggings but no belts or side arms.
If the officers are uncovered the privates should
not wear hats but have campaign hats in their hands.
The hats should have green cords. A nickel-pla-
ted cross (of red cross variety) is the hat insignia.

Wait - before you go to the courts for a “cease and desist”
order against me just let me say, “with kindest regards”,
